intro: Bouteloua eludens, commonly known as the slender grama, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its fine, grass-like foliage and small, pale blue to purple flowers. This plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is drought-tolerant and often used in native plant landscaping due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal. The species plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
